conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to understand velocity, time, and distance relationship.
The v-t graph shows velocity of objects A and B as functions of time.
Area under the v-t curve represents displacement over time.
Calculate displacement by finding area under v-t curves from t = 0 to t.
Relative displacement is the difference in displacements of A and B.
Find time t when relative displacement is maximum.
From t = 0 to t1, A's velocity increases linearly, B's decreases then increases.
Area under A's curve is greater than B's, so A is ahead of B.
At t1, both objects have the same velocity.
A has more displacement at t1 due to higher initial velocity.
From t1 to t2, B's velocity increases more rapidly than A's.
Area under B's curve starts catching up with A's.
At t2, both objects have the same velocity again.
B has more displacement than A at t2.
Maximum relative displacement occurs when area difference is greatest, at t1.
The two objects are farthest apart at time t1.
